title: Cycle Lengths
content: The set of all **cycle lengths** in a graph G, using Mathlib's Walk.IsCycle predicate. A cycle is a closed walk with no repeated vertices except endpoints.

title: Odd Cycle Lengths
content: The set of all **odd cycle lengths** in G. These are the key objects relating to chromatic number bounds in this problem.

title: Number of Odd Cycle Lengths
content: The count of distinct odd cycle lengths in G, denoted k in the theorem statements. Uses Set.ncard for cardinality of potentially infinite sets.

title: k-Colorable
content: A graph is **k-colorable** if there exists f: V → Fin k with adjacent vertices receiving different colors. Standard graph coloring definition.

title: Chromatic Number
content: The **chromatic number** χ(G) is the minimum k for which G is k-colorable. Axiomatized here for simplicity, with specification given separately.

title: Contains Clique
content: G **contains K_n** if there exists a set S of n vertices that are pairwise adjacent. This characterizes when equality holds in Gyárfás' bound.

title: Gyárfás Upper Bound (1992)
content: **Main Result**: If G has at most k distinct odd cycle lengths, then χ(G) ≤ 2k+2. This is the core of the solved conjecture.

title: Gyárfás Equality Characterization
content: **Equality Case**: χ(G) = 2k+2 with ≤k odd cycle lengths iff G contains K_{2k+2}. Complete graphs are the extremal examples.

title: Gyárfás Structural Result
content: **2-Connected Case**: If G is 2-connected with ≤k odd cycle lengths, then G contains K_{2k+2} or has a vertex of degree ≤2k. Powerful structural dichotomy.

title: Bollobás-Shelah (k=1)
content: **Special Case**: At most 1 odd cycle length implies χ ≤ 4. This was proved before Gyárfás' general result and motivated the conjecture.

title: Bipartite Case (k=0)
content: **k=0 Case**: No odd cycles implies χ ≤ 2 (bipartite). This is the classical result that odd-cycle-free graphs are 2-colorable.

title: Consecutive Odd Lengths
content: A set of **consecutive odd integers** {2m+1, 2m+3, ...}. Used in the Gao-Huo-Ma strengthening.

title: Gao-Huo-Ma Theorem (2021)
content: **Strengthening**: If χ(G) ≥ 2k+3, then G has k+1 consecutive odd cycle lengths. High chromatic number forces very structured odd cycles.

title: χ ≥ 5 Corollary
content: If χ(G) ≥ 5, then G has at least 2 distinct odd cycle lengths. Derived by contrapositive from Gyárfás' bound with k=1.
